listings.title: Principal Software Engineer
listings.description: Have you ever imagined the world with an infinite amount of storage available and accessible to everyone? A place where everyone in the world can easily access their books/music/photos/video/any data from anywhere at any time via any means (e.g. mobile phones, tablets, PCs, smart devices, etc). Did you ever desire a universally accessible storage system to record all the knowledge known to mankind, to keep all the books/music/videos ever created, or to store all the data collected from all the scientists in the world for them to collaborate upon? Do you want to be part of a team that strives to bring these to reality?  If so, the Microsoft Azure Storage team is what you are looking for. We are building Microsoft’s cloud storage solution - Microsoft Azure Storage, which is a massively scalable, highly distributed, ubiquitously accessible storage system, designed to scale out and serve the entire world. We continue to have tremendous hockey stick growth, we have many Exabyte’s of data stored, and are designing and building systems for Zettabyte scale to support demand growth for the coming years.  We are looking for engineers who are passionate about distributed storage, more specifically in the areas of resource management of distributed systems across an entire geo-region! Candidates who want to work on a fast-paced team with talented engineers will thrive here. The Azure Storage Limitless and Cluster Resource Manager Team manages control and data plane operations that manage hundreds of thousands of servers at exabyte scale while serving hundreds of millions of requests per seconds at low latency. We provide the semantics to virtualize customer accounts and physical hardware across entire geo regions. We also develop and maintain infrastructure related to high performance transfer of customer accounts across storage scale units. Additionally, these areas present challenging technical problems in a space where innovation is always happening.  To be successful in these areas, you must thrive while solving challenges related to durability, availability and concurrency for a distributed system. You will have an opportunity to make high impact changes on a daily basis as you build a hyper scale storage system that may indirectly or directly be used daily by your friends and family.  Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

listings.title: Senior Software Engineer
listings.description: Microsoft is a company where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envision what can be and take their careers further. This is a world of more possibilities, more innovation, more openness, and the sky is the limit thinking in a cloud-enabled world.  Microsoft’s Azure Data engineering team is leading the transformation of analytics in the world of data with products like databases, data integration, big data analytics, messaging & real-time analytics, and business intelligence. The products our portfolio include Microsoft Fabric, Azure SQL DB, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure PostgreSQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Grid, and Power BI. Our mission is to build the data platform for the age of AI, powering a new class of data-first applications and driving a data culture.  Within Azure Data, the databases team builds and maintains Microsoft's operational Database systems. We store and manage data in a structured way to enable multitude of applications across various industries. We are on a journey to enable developer friendly, mission-critical, AI enabled operational Databases across relational, non-relational and OSS offerings.  ​​We are the Azure SQL Database Storage/IO resource governance  team, part of the Microsoft Azure’s C+ AI organization. Our team is responsible to ensure high efficiency of operations while interacting with storage which persists with the data. In addition to maintaining an efficient Quality of Service (QoS) with respect to latency and bandwidth, the team is also responsible for ensuring the customer gets the right kind of storage medium based on their need and historical usage pattern. Based on the customer needs, the team is responsible for putting them on the right tier of storage, moving them across to a different storage medium if desired with minimal downtime, analyze and rectify customer workload for efficient storage utilization. Azure SQL has more than 100 million databases under its belt, and for its efficient operation has an even higher number of storage resources allocated. The team is responsible for efficient functioning of storage on all parameters and for all services. At your disposal will be SQL's state-of-the-art management system, a sophisticated engine, and terabytes of telemetry to make informed decisions.  With this unprecedented growth comes added complexity in our database storage ecosystem, at scales we never imagined before. As a Senior Software Engineer, this is your opportunity to take on a challenge to build and improve database storage infra with cutting-edge technologies. This team is on a mission to define and deliver a world class storage infra for relational database, that position infrastructure as a key differentiator for customer value and business margins. We do not just value differences or different perspectives. We seek them out and invite them in so we can tap into the collective power of everyone in the company. As a result, our customers are better served.
listings.responsibilities: Stay updated on recent trends in the database world focusing on storage, networking, reliability, scalability, and security. Be open to experimenting with promising trends in these areas that might open avenues of growth in SQL DB. Provide guidance and mentor other engineers, enabling them to succeed in the team and space. Conduct code reviews that help shape and steer the team coding guidelines. Develop deep insights into customer utilization of their databases and resources available. Employ reliable analytical skills to build flexible infrastructure to learn, and model, current and future database resource consumption, while efficiently running business scenarios to replicate changes in service architecture and its effect on usage patterns. Identifying opportunities to maximize utilization of the underlying storage service we provision for our customers.  Focus on building the necessary storage infrastructure, and models (with terabytes of service logging telemetry) that allow us to make prudent, and informed decisions with respect to SQL DB storage infrastructure.  Ensure service viability and success with dependable understanding of a variety of business and engineering factors. Including: the adoption of different SQL DB offerings, the usage patterns of customers, and the resource/IO limits of our clusters and Azure Storage service. Be a trusted influencer in SQLDB’s business strategy when it comes to COGS and Gross Margins. Opportunity to write the book for a capability that hasn’t existed in the business before.  Embody our culture and values

listings.title: Digital Sales Enterprise - Security
listings.description: Digital Sales Enterprise, part of Microsoft's Digital sales organization, empowers our customers through the unique value of the Microsoft Cloud by building a globally-led, digital-first scale organization aligned with partners. As part of our local subsidiaries or Digital Sales centers around the world, you will engage a dedicated set of enterprise customers to identify and achieve their business objectives through best-in-class digital engagement and partner co-selling. You will also have an opportunity to work collaboratively across teams while living our shared Digital Sales Culture priorities: Diversity and Inclusivity, Wellbeing, Sustainability, and Customer Obsession.  In the Digital Sales Enterprise Security Specialist team, we are looking for a passionate, experienced, and credible sales professional with a passion for enhancing the security capabilities of the world’s leading enterprise organizations to join our global team of Digital Security Specialists.  Fueled by an integrated approach that blends compliance, identity management, and AI-driven automation you will be a part of our vision to safeguard digital ecosystems through end-to-end security thought leadership, driving significant customer value and enabling transformational customer outcomes.  We are looking for an Enterprise Digital Specialist, specializing in Security solutions, you will work with our most important customers within our enterprise organization. You will drive the day-to-day execution of Microsoft's strategic business priorities – selling best-in-class cloud services and platforms to our managed customers and building digital transformation momentum for our customers, partners, and Microsoft.  Passion for Security: You will have the opportunity to enhance the security capabilities of the world's leading enterprise organizations, fueled by an integrated approach that blends compliance, identity management, and AI-driven automation.  Safeguard Digital Ecosystems: Be part of our vision to safeguard digital ecosystems. As part of our mission, we champion a Zero Trust mindset, empowering organizations worldwide.  Beyond today's technology: You will work directly with enterprise customers to help them unlock the value of AI across their organization and help them understand how AI and Automation can advance their security capabilities.  This role is flexible in that you can work up to 50% from home. Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. As a Digital Security Specialist, you’ll work with customers to identify their cybersecurity needs and recommend suitable Microsoft solutions. You’ll collaborate with various customer groups to enhance their security through digital transformation strategies. Leading customer conversations, you’ll coordinate with internal teams and partners to maximize security opportunities.  Sales Excellence: Leads and plans for named accounts in the assigned territory, proactively builds an external stakeholder mapping to accelerate the closing of deals. Performs business analysis to pursue high-potential customers and manage the end-to-end Security business across the assigned territory by driving consumption and licensing transactions to grow business within assigned territory. Scaling and Collaboration: Collaborates on the planning, orchestration, and execution on Security opportunities with virtual teams made up of internal stakeholders and partners to cross-sell and up-sell. Industry Awareness: Initiates and leads Security conversations, shares best practices, key competitor knowledge and customer insights across solution areas to elevate team capabilities and make recommendations on pursuit or withdrawal. Sales Execution: Drives new sales and new customer engagements using innovative approaches, leveraging digital signals, partnership events, social selling (LinkedIn) and networking opportunities. Learning: Completes required training and obtain relevant security expertise and certifications aligned to the role.

listings.title: Cloud Solution Architect - Azure Core
listings.description: Azure is the most comprehensive, innovative and flexible cloud platform today and Microsoft is hiring professionals that will drive customer cloud adoption within the most important companies in the market. We are always learning. Insatiably curious. We lean into uncertainty, take risks, and learn quickly from our mistakes. We build on each other’s ideas because we are better together. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. Together we make a difference.  In the Customer Success team we are looking for people with a passion for delivering customer success working with Microsoft’s strategic partners. As a Cloud Solution Architect you will work with our strategic partners to enable them to achieve their customer outcomes, based on their investments in Microsoft technology. Leveraging your technical subject matter expertise you will lead technical conversations with partners to drive value from their MS investments, including identifying resolutions to issues blocking customer success projects. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, honing your technical and collaboration skills, and deepening your cloud expertise.  Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  We are currently looking for Cloud Solution Architect - Azure Core professionals to join our teams across various business groups, for varying customer sizes, in our enterprise, regulated, and partner services organizations. By applying to this role, you will be considered for multiple opportunities within Microsoft across the United States including locations beyond where the role is posted. This role is flexible in that you can work up to 50% from home. Travel percentages will very according to role. Other
listings.responsibilities: Gathers customer/partner insights (e.g., feedback around technical preferences, environments, business needs) and leverages these insights and existing plans to map solutions with customer/partner business outcomes. Acts as the voice of the customer (VOC)/partner by driving awareness of existing feedback, insights, and resources with internal teams to add and prioritize. Shares customer success stories with the wider internal team. Identifies and begins developing impactful relationships with internal teams and customer and partner technical specialists during initial preparation and ramp-up stages. Proposes viable solutions based on specific technical products. Demonstrates complex concepts, and proves the capability of those solutions through design collaboration sessions with the customer/partner. Understands how work aligns with customer success plan and meets customer/partner needs by working with internal teams to deliver customer outcomes. Supports customer skilling by delivering as a trusted technical advisor to ensure customer readiness by facilitating technical discussions and enabling operational health and cloud readiness. Transfers knowledge to customers close customer skill gaps. Contributes to customer satisfaction by providing a positive customer/partner experience. Demonstrates an understanding of customer/partner conditions of success. Identifies dissatisfied customers and builds remedial actions (e.g., post-mortem reviews). Actively listens and respectfully challenges customers/partners when going in the wrong direction and escalates appropriately. Independently identifies issues and advises customers/partners to operate and optimize performance in accordance with Microsoft best practices. Escalates issues to appropriate team members or manager, as needed. Applies methodology and governance to minimize business and technical risks and adhere to quality assurance while ensuring excellence in contributions to design and/or delivery of solutions. Adheres to quality assurance standards and calculates risks while ensuring excellence in the design and/or delivery of solutions. Leverages standard tools to ensure accurate opportunity and milestone execution and pipeline hygiene. Independently works with the customer to identify, determine root causes, and resolve blockers to accelerate consumption and solution implementation (e.g., by application of technical capabilities). Identifies non-technical issues and escalates for removal by the appropriate party. Applies business and technical knowledge of architecture or other Microsoft solutions to meet business and information technology (IT) requirements and resolve identified technical constraints. Helps to shape and enhance customers' requirements. Leverages knowledge of the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft and its competitors in customer/partner conversations to assess customer/partner needs and independently identify growth opportunities. Leverages an existing architecture approach or reference architecture to propose a solution or achieve Microsoft's Customer Promise. Identifies opportunities to expand or accelerate consumption (e.g., cloud and support). Participates in discussions around architecture design, resiliency reviews, and technical optimization that result in production deployment application and increase customer/partner usage and consumption. Independently consults on technical solution design, development, and deployment and supports the customer/partner throughout implementation to achieve value outcomes and Microsoft's Customer Promise. Understands the competitor's architecture solutions and identifies Microsoft's strengths over competitive solutions to demonstrate Microsoft's value to customers/partners. Leverages development opportunities (e.g., mentorships, role-based resources, trainings, internal events such as Ready, Build, Ignite) to learn new technologies and services as advised by leadership team/manager. Shares ideas, insights, and technical input with virtual team members using a working knowledge of specific Microsoft architectures and other relevant products. Participates in external technical community events (e.g., conferences, seminars, technical meetups, Webcasts, blogs, hackathons) and shares learnings with the internal team. Supports research projects and contributes to scoping surveys for customers/partners to assess potential intellectual property (IP) needs or process changes. Supports identification of opportunities for IP reuse and consumption acceleration. Contributes to IP creation and updates by identifying gaps through delivery and communicating those gaps to others (e.g., Leadership, managed intellectual property [MIP], Design, and Governance). Embody our culture and values

Additional or Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, Business, or related field AND 5+ years experience in cloud/infrastructure technologies, information technology (IT) consulting/support, systems administration, network operations, software development/support, technology solutions, practice development, architecture, and/or consulting OR equivalent experience. 2+ years experience working in a customer-facing role (e.g., internal and/or external). 2+ years experience working on technical projects. listings.title: Principal Product Manager
listings.description: Our team is focused on delivering world class experiences across Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Office 365 & LinkedIn.   We're looking for product leadership as we deliver our next generation of experiences that enable modern sales workflows for organizations of all shapes and sizes.  You will be responsible for building and managing the product roadmap, designing features, and delivering them to unlock new experiences for Dynamics 365 for Sales.  Microsoft Dynamics 365 is an industry leading and rapidly growing line of SaaS-based business applications.  Our team is focused on building capabilities into Microsoft’s fast-growing CRM platform, Dynamics 365 for Sales, leveraging Microsoft’s innovation across technologies such as Generative AI and Mixed Reality.  Our team is looking for a seasoned product manager with a proven track record designing, building and launching SaaS applications.  This role is a mix of product strategy, user-centric design, cross-team collaboration, and external customer engagement. It’s a high value role that’s both creative and technical with the opportunity to redefine how sellers work and collaborate.  To be successful in this role, you must be experienced in collaborating across teams and disciplines, cutting through ambiguity and getting products shipped with the highest quality.  Excellence across the entire product lifecycle – from ideation and planning to user retention and customer success – is critical to delivering success to the business and to customers.  Our team innovates quickly and works closely with our partners and customers in a very agile, high-energy environment.  This is an opportunity to work in a close capacity with a highly talented team of software engineers, designers and product managers to drive forward new innovative experiences in close partnership with customers.  If you have the vision and passion to make amazing products that customers love, then this is the job for you.
listings.responsibilities: Support ideation, vision, strategy and roadmap for Dynamics 365 Sales capabilities.   Define and drive feature specification, work closely with engineering teams to deliver against the roadmap for your ownership area.    Work with internal and external partners to gather feedback, manage dependencies.  Regularly present new product plans, status updates and more to the product team, leadership teams and customers.     Drive rhythm of business activities within the team and across the org to ensure end-to-end success of initiatives.  Ensure customer success for all customers, working closely with key accounts.    Define, and track usage & business success metrics.
listings.Qualifications: Qualifications  Required   12+ years of Product Management experience, or equivalent, with experience in customer and market development.  Passionate about helping customers and identifying the solution that delivers the most impact to their business.  Self-starter that thrives in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment with proven track record of delivering on commitments.   Experience building strong working relationships with, collaborating with and influencing diverse cross-functional teams (engineering, product, sales, marketing, etc.).    Thrives in team-based work, performs well in high-intensity environments, and is willing to roll up their sleeves to get things done for customers.   Sets and holds teams to tight timelines and high-quality deliverables without explicit authority.   Demonstrated experience in gathering and transforming customer needs into an actionable product requirements definition.   BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field or equivalent experience.       Preferred   MBA.  Previous experience driving strategic efforts for SaaS products, serving thousands of globally dispersed users.

listings.title: Technical Support Engineering Manager
listings.description: With over 18,000 employees worldwide, the Microsoft Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is responsible for the strategy, design, and implementation of Microsoft’s end-to-end customer experience. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers come to us not only because we provide industry-leading products and services, but also because we provide a differentiated and connected customer experience.  Within CE&S, the Customer Service & Support (CSS) organization builds trust and confidence for every person and organization through delivering a seamless support experience. In CSS, we help customers and partners resolve their issues quickly, prevent future problems from occurring, and demonstrate new ways to achieve more from their Microsoft investment.  In Modern Work (MW), we help our customers get and stay productive with Microsoft 365 product families. As a Support Engineering Manager you will lead a team or group of Support Engineers with deep product knowledge that resolve customer technical issues. You will manage the customer relationship from a support standpoint, enable your team to deliver a great customer experience and drive Microsoft Product Improvement. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth and hone your customer relationship management skills. You will develop deep technology industry knowledge and become adept at building and leading diverse teams. This role is flexible in that you can work up to 50% from home. Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  People Management You lead a team/ group of product experts that solve complex customer technical issues by practicing leadership principles, driving accountability and attracting/ retaining great people  Response and Resolution You manage the customer relationship with regards to Technical Support and acting as an escalation point for Support Engineers to remove roadblocks and help prioritize technical issues at a global level.  Readiness You ensure your team has the technical skills required to provide a great customer experience and you collaborate with engineering /product teams to fill document gaps regarding new and existing technology  Product/Process Improvement You communicate aggregated customer feedback and set operational frameworks and standards to drive product and process improvements  Business Integration You identify opportunities to collaborate effectively across other teams and organizations to enable a great customer experience

listings.title: Critical Infrastructure Network Engineering Manager
listings.description: In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Critical Infrastructure Network Engineering Manager.  Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a Critical Infrastructure Network Engineering Manager you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. Your responsibilities will be to oversee the design, installation, and maintenance of the network infrastructure for the organization. You will also be responsible for managing a team of network engineers, ensuring that they have the necessary skills, tools, and resources to perform their tasks efficiently and effectively. You will also be involved in planning and implementing network security policies and procedures, as well as troubleshooting and resolving any network issues that may arise. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, develop deep business acumen, drive business impact, and improve network service availability. With a flexible workplace, you can work from home partially or fully and/or come to the office/lab on an as needed basis.  As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications. Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 100 datacenters and 1 million servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.  With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action! People Management and Support Network Design and Implementation  Maintaining and Operating Networks Project Management Other

listings.title: ​​Senior Site Reliability Engineer​
listings.description: Microsoft is a company where passionate innovators come to collaborate, envision what can be and take their careers further. This is a world of more possibilities, more innovation, more openness, and the sky is the limit thinking in a cloud-enabled world.    Microsoft’s Azure Data engineering team is leading the transformation of analytics in the world of data with products like databases, data integration, big data analytics, messaging & real-time analytics, and business intelligence. The products our portfolio include Microsoft Fabric, Azure SQL DB, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure PostgreSQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Service Bus, Azure Event Grid, and Power BI. Our mission is to build the data platform for the age of AI, powering a new class of data-first applications and driving a data culture.  ​​Within Azure Data, the databases team builds and maintains Microsoft's operational Database systems. We store and manage data in a structured way to enable multitude of applications across various industries. We are on a journey to enable developer friendly, mission-critical, AI enabled operational Databases across relational, non-relational and OSS offerings.​ ​​Azure Cosmos DB is Microsoft’s next generation globally distributed, massively scalable, multi-model cloud database service. It is designed to enable developers to build planet-scale applications. Azure Cosmos DB is one of the fastest growing Azure services. Joining the Azure Cosmos DB team is a fantastic opportunity to work with highly talented engineers operating like a startup, and to deliver on our next set of big challenges.       As a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, you will identify and deliver software improvements using your expertise in software development, complexity analysis, and scalable system design to ensure services/systems are highly stable, performant, and meeting the expectations of our customers. You will work closely with other engineering teams and provide a holistic view of our cloud service. ​​ We do not just value differences or different perspectives. We seek them out and invite them in so we can tap into the collective power of everyone in the company. As a result, our customers are better served. ​​Identify opportunities and drive the design and implementation of end-to-end telemetry, alerting, self-healing and automation capabilities to improve service health, manageability, and reliability.     Participate in on-call rotations and own, triage, investigate and resolve service issues with an emphasis on broad communications, learning & teaching throughout the process.     Interact with customers / support representatives and communicate on a deeply technical level with product engineering and product management teams to evolve services.      Own availability, performance, and supportability targets for the service.     Author functional and technical documentation and remain current on relevant technologies and procedures.     ​ Embody our culture and values

listings.Qualifications: Qualifications     ​Bachelor's degree in computer science/Engineering/related fields or equivalent industry experience.     6+ years of experience with writing tools, automation / scripting (Powershell, Python or similar), programming (C++, C# or equivalent) and making enhancements in subcomponents within and around services/products to deliver and manage software in production.     6+ years of troubleshooting/debugging experience: telemetry-based analysis (KQL or equivalent preferred), troubleshooting skills across network, hardware, and distributed service layers, with demonstrated ability to debug, fix, and optimize code.     Good communications skills, both verbal and written.     Other Requirements   Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:   This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.     Preferred/Additional Qualifications   ​​Experience aiding understanding of distributed systems and networking is preferred.​         #azdat   #azuredata   ​​#cosmosdb #databases​

listings.title: Partner Technology Strategist
listings.description: The Global Partner Solutions (GPS) team is a sales organization accountable for the commercial partner business at Microsoft, and the mission is to build and sell Microsoft Cloud applications, services and devices with partners, empowering people, and organizations to achieve more. Join our team as a Partner Technology Strategist and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of digital transformation for our partners. By leveraging your strategic mindset, technical expertise, and persuasive communication skills, you will drive our partners' success and unlock new possibilities in the ever-evolving world of technology.
listings.responsibilities: Cloud Strategy Alignment: Serve as the technical owner of our partners' business solutions, collaborating closely with stakeholders to align their technology roadmap with Microsoft's cloud offerings. This includes understanding partners' business objectives, providing strategic guidance, and helping them leverage the full potential of the Microsoft cloud to achieve their goals by building SaaS solution offers. You will champion the adoption of cutting-edge cloud technologies, accelerate time to market, and identify new business opportunities that drive our partners' success. Stay at the forefront of emerging cloud technologies, industry trends, and best practices. By providing thought leadership and encouraging experimentation, you will help our partners differentiate themselves in the market and drive transformative change. By driving joint success and achieving shared business objectives, you will establish long-lasting partnerships. Passion for exploring emerging cloud technologies and driving transformative change. Ability to drive decisions collaboratively, resolve conflicts, and ensure follow-through. Trusted Advisor Proven track record in providing strategic technology guidance and advisory services to partners (preferred) or customers. Ability to align technology solutions with business goals, develop technology roadmaps, and deliver actionable recommendations. Skilled in resolving technical blockers and driving envisioning of new and groundbreaking capabilities in technology roadmaps. Ability to articulate complex technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences. Serve as the technical owner of our partners' business solutions, collaborating closely with stakeholders to align their technology roadmap with Microsoft's cloud offerings. This includes understanding partners' business objectives, providing strategic guidance, and helping them leverage the full potential of the Microsoft cloud to achieve their goals by building SaaS solution offers. Lead our partners through the complex process of cloud transformation, adopting a Technical Sales Challenger mindset to challenge conventional thinking. You will champion the adoption of cutting-edge cloud technologies, accelerate time to market, and identify new business opportunities that drive our partners' success. Embrace a culture of innovation and inspire our partners to adopt a tech-intensive mindset. Stay at the forefront of emerging cloud technologies, industry trends, and best practices. By providing thought leadership and encouraging experimentation, you will help our partners differentiate themselves in the market and drive transformative change. Cultivate strong relationships with partners, acting as a trusted advisor to CTOs, executives, and technical teams. Foster collaboration, trust, and open communication channels to ensure seamless alignment between our partners and Microsoft. By driving joint success and achieving shared business objectives, you will establish long-lasting partnerships. Demonstrated leadership capabilities, driving business growth, fostering innovation, and navigating complex organizational landscapes. Passion for exploring emerging cloud technologies and driving transformative change. Ability to drive decisions collaboratively, resolve conflicts, and ensure follow-through. Proven track record in providing strategic technology guidance and advisory services to partners (preferred) or customers. Ability to align technology solutions with business goals, develop technology roadmaps, and deliver actionable recommendations. Proven ability in strategy formulation, with a strong understanding of business strategies and the ability to lead the adoption of technologies by developing strategic, long-term visions for partners. Skilled in resolving technical blockers and driving envisioning of new and groundbreaking capabilities in technology roadmaps. Ability to articulate complex technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences.

listings.title: Principal Business Architect
listings.description: Microsoft Cloud Operations + Innovation is the team behind the cloud. CO+I is responsible for delivering over 200 Microsoft web portals, Live and Online Services around the world including infrastructure, security and compliance, operations, globalization, and manageability. Our focus is on smart growth, high efficiency, and delivering a trusted experience to customers and partners worldwide. We are looking for a passionate, high-energy individual to help build the network that powers the world’s largest online services. The Infrastructure Planning and Acquisition Center of Excellence team (IPA CoE) is responsible for enabling and optimizing the foundation that supports infrastructure delivery for Land, Energy, Networking, and Datacenter Planning through efficient processes, data driven decision making, innovation, and automated and integrated tool sets.  As a Principal Business Architect, you will design and develop enterprise-level architecture that enables comprehensive and cohesive business strategy, anchored in value delivery and realization. This includes evaluating the overall maturity level of the organization across processes, people, and technology to create a clear picture of where investments are needed to address capability gaps and unlock full potential. This position ensures a repeatable and efficient approach to evaluating both operating and business models to support organizational change efforts, specifically focused on transformation. The Business Architecture function will be responsible for translating our OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) and business initiatives into a refined strategic Business Value Roadmap with functional definition and clarity, while championing business case development for funding and approvals. A successful candidate will bring a quality and scalability mindset, while cultivating a customer-focused, innovative, and collaborative team culture.  In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
listings.responsibilities: Develops an enterprise outline of core and supporting business processes, including holistic details across people, resources, technology, and data. Adapts and implements industry-standard Maturity Model assessments to evaluate organizational and functional operations, leading gap identification and opportunity evaluation as key inputs to the overarching business value roadmap. Defines Business Architecture efforts across the organization through a principles-based approach to guiding customer satisfaction, marketplace positioning, supplier management, scalable operations, and a unified work environment. Builds Capability Sets required to achieve the North Star Vision and sequence them for an Architecture Roadmap. Works with Capability PMs to ensure the Proposed Architecture is understood and executed successfully. Ensures all proposed and approved programs align with and contribute to the defined business architecture. Leads envision efforts for mid- and long-term strategies across business segments, providing clarity and organization for the future state that the business architecture  support. Engages strategically with functional leaders as a trusted advisor to transform and scale business operations, consulted on all major processes, technology, or data change projects. Collaborates with key stakeholder groups to articulate strategy and initiative deliverables to capabilities, process, BI, and development teams, ensuring well-socialized change programs, high user adoption, and business value realization. Champions operational excellence by establishing Business Value Delivery metrics that are meaningful and action-oriented, ensuring progress towards overall goals and establishing processes for regular assessment and continuous improvements.

listings.title: Partner Account Manager
listings.description: Microsoft is looking for an individual to help launch and shape the Microsoft Advertising Japan Channel Partner Sales team. Do you have experience building high-performing business partnerships while driving material value to partners and customers? Do you want be part of the fastest growing advertising revenue stream for Microsoft?  Do you want to drive business strategy while gaining a deep, end-to-end perspective of the  Microsoft Advertising business? If so, the Channel Partner team within Microsoft Advertising is the place for you.  Microsoft Advertising is the destination for experienced, collaborative, and passionate digital advertising professionals seeking a rewarding career and lifestyle. We offer a compelling portfolio of advertising products, innovative solutions and the opportunity to engage with some of the brightest minds in the digital industry. Microsoft Advertising’s Global Partner & Retail Media Team (GPRM) is a global sales organization within Microsoft Advertising (MSA). GPRM is on the cutting edge of the digital advertising industry, helping Microsoft solidify its position as a technology provider that powers the buying and selling of digital advertising across all aspects of our digital portfolio. We’re looking for a candidate who can work confidently in a matrix organization and build relationships at the right level to drive satisfaction, loyalty and ultimately business results with several Microsoft Advertising Partners. The Partner Account Manager (PAM) is responsible for building and maintaining deep business relationships with our key partners and Tool Providers throughout APAC and serving as their advocate across Microsoft and the GPRM team. The position will drive share of wallet growth, new account acquisition and partner satisfaction in the account by implementing scalable and targeted solutions that help partners reach their audience. The PAM will ensure the partner is set up for success on the Microsoft Advertising platform and network by collaborating with internal teams to provide an effective and efficient service and driving the core elements of the overall partner account plan. The PAM will also work to influence Tool Providers to take a forward-looking view by building the right technology capabilities and knowledge within the partner organisation so they can manage and grow their customer base across their market. Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.  ◎日本マイクロソフトの福利厚生や社員インタビューが掲載されたキャリア採用情報は、下記URLよりご確認下さい。 https://www.microsoft.com/ja-jp/mscorp/mid-career/default.aspx  #JPMSA #MicrosoftAdvertising
listings.responsibilities: Relationship-Account Management Build and cultivate deep business relationships with our partners and actively drive the highest levels of partner satisfaction. Serve as the face of Microsoft Advertising and act as a hub/point of contact for the partner.  Working with the PSE, help develop and own strategic partner account plans – set aggressive targets and drive execution of mutually beneficial conditions of satisfaction.  Provide targeted solutions that set our partners up for success and provide ongoing service and support, deliver industry-leading SLAs for account management activities and collaborate across multiple teams in a matrix environment to ensure optimal service management for clients.  Develop the relationship with the supporting tool provider where appropriate.  Lead partner engagement rhythm & meetings/calls including business reviews and solution selling opportunities. Ensure the right conversations are happening at the right level to grow the account. Actively follow up on all actions.  Work across the organisation to ensure issues and requests are channeled to the right groups and are resolved as per commitments and SLA.  Provide comprehensive reporting with appropriate local data that helps drive the engagement and partnership and results in opportunities and growth.  Build the right capabilities/knowledge (campaign management and optimization tactics) within the partner organisation so they can self-serve/manage/grow. Growth/Revenue Grow revenue in the existing book of business and drive the specific revenue targets across all accounts through up-sell and opportunity management.  Manage core scorecard metrics – revenue, MSAN adoption, total performing accounts, account penetration, ARPA and Partner Satisfaction. Implement correction of error plans where appropriate for non-green metrics.  Proactively identify opportunities to drive additional revenue.  Drive a strategic discussion: grow the account by taking a future looking approach and setting plans in action to realise goals.  Drive feature adoption. Contribute to the Microsoft Advertising Partner Team Unit (PTU) Proactively share insights to inform policies, manage channel conflict and exploit revenue opportunities.  Assist the PTU planning and forecasting process through a pipeline of existing and prospective partnerships.  Collaborate with PTU members globally to share best practices and develop the global partner business.
listings.Qualifications: Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Computer Science or a related discipline  5-7 years’ experience in account management, client service, or marketing analytics roles  Demonstrated ability to build deep and influential relationships with partners and/or customers at senior levels  Proven ability to drive a strategic discussion, scaling vertically where needed and impacting at multiple levels in a large organization  Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of business  5 years of paid search and/or display advertising experience at a publisher or agency  Strong quantitative and analytical skills   Excellent online marketing skills and Excel expertise; keen ability to link data to insights and actions  Ability to develop and implement creative solutions and influence others in their adoption.    Excellent oral and written communication skills, including presentation experience and interpersonal skills    Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, projects, and deadlines   Ability to travel 10-20% of the time  Language fluency both in Japanese and English

listings.title: Principal IT Lifecycle Management Manager
listings.description: In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact on our culture every day and we need you as a Principal IT Lifecycle Management Manager.  Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I Principal IT Lifecycle Management Manager, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on personal and professional development for all employees and offers trainings and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion trainings and events, and professional certifications.  Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 data centers in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide. With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.  As the Principal IT Lifecycle Management Manager, you will drive the delivery of world-class cloud services across your region, interact and maintain relationships with various stakeholders and partners. You will focus on managing the entire IT lifecycle for the region, from initial deployment to decommissioning, and the related activities, ensuring adherence to the highest standards of safety, security, and environmental responsibility. Excellent interpersonal awareness, ability to navigate ambiguity, and your mature communication skills will be pivotal in bringing your program management, technical abilities, and leadership experiences to a whole new level in supporting Microsoft’s success!  Do you want to empower billions across the world? Come and join us in CO+I and be at the forefront of the action! As a Principal IT Lifecycle Management Manager, your success is measured by:  People Management  Datacenter Operations – IT Lifecycle Management
listings.responsibilities: Deliver success through empowerment and accountability by modeling, coaching, and caring. Model - Live our culture; Embody our values; Practice our leadership principles. Coach - Define team objectives and outcomes; Enable success across boundaries; Help the team adapt and learn. Care - Attract and retain great people; Know each individual’s capabilities and aspirations; Invest in the growth of others. Empower a culture of safety, security, and compliance in all aspects of datacenter operations. Leadership, management, coaching, and development of Microsoft full time employees across datacenters in your region. Collaborate, communicate, present, and negotiate effectively across groups of various levels and disciplines, such as senior Microsoft leaders, suppliers, partners, technicians, etc. Management and oversight of vendor/partner contracts and relationships including Fleet Management, IT service providers, and partner support teams. Collaborate with global and regional management teams and contribute to improvement programs. Lead projects and programs related to continuous improvements including business case development. Learn, live, and coach the One Microsoft culture and values. Lead through change by bringing clarity, generating energy, and delivering success.

Supply chain, procurement, vendor management and fiscal planning background and experience. Awareness of IT Service Operations fundamentals and principles. (ITIL, MOF, OLA/SLA, CSI, etc.).     Background Check Requirements:  The ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. listings.title: Product Quality and Reliability Engineer
listings.description: Microsoft is leading the way into the growth of High-Performance Computing and Artificial Intelligence. Recently Microsoft has announced Cobalt and Maia Custom Silicon for Azure Data Center and AI. Microsoft Silicon Engineering is pushing technology hard in all areas including advanced packaging technology. We are looking for Product Quality and Reliability (PQRE)Engineer that has strong technical experience in the area of HPC/AI/GPU/CPU’s End2End Quality Management System (QMS), Failure Analysis and RMA. The position will have responsibilities for Silicon Product Quality and Reliability Engineering for Microsoft’s Cobalt and Maia Silicon that is used for Azure Data Center and AI.  The position will have the following responsibilities:  Customer obsessed We will learn about our customers and their businesses with a beginner’s mind and then bring solutions that meet their needs. We will be insatiable in our desire to learn from the outside and bring it into Microsoft, while still innovating to surprise and delight our users.  Diverse & inclusive The world is diverse. We will better serve everyone on the planet by representing everyone on the planet. We will be open to learning our own biases and changing our behaviors, so we can tap into the collective power of everyone at Microsoft. We don’t just value differences, we seek them out, we invite them in. And as a result, our ideas are better, our products are better, and our customers are better served.  One Microsoft We are a family of individuals united by a single, shared mission. It’s our ability to work together that makes our dreams believable and ultimately achievable. We will build on the ideas of others and collaborate across boundaries to bring the best of Microsoft to our customers as one. We are proud to be part of team Microsoft.  Making a difference If we commit to being customer obsessed, becoming more diverse and inclusive, and operating as One Microsoft, we will achieve our mission to empower every person and organization on the planet. Beyond that, we will make a difference and find deep meaning in our work. We stand in awe of what humans dare to achieve and are motivated every day to empower others to do more and achieve more through our technology and innovation. We fundamentally believe that we need a culture founded in a Growth Mindset. It starts with a belief that everyone can grow and develop; that potential is nurtured, not pre-determined; and that anyone can change their mindset.
listings.responsibilities: Define and build silicon/assembly/package qualification requirement and responsible for product qualification and technology certification. This is based on physical understanding, model prediction and quality & reliability of advanced product, transistor, interconnect, assembly/package and wafer/package tests. Drive product qualification and reliability (Q&R) validation, ongoing quality and reliability monitoring and build cost effective test/mfg screen solution to ensure stable process technology and product meets the committed Q&R specs and performance. Q&R engineering of volume manufacturing which covers yield monitoring, DOE, analysis, risk assessment and disposition of any reliability read out issues. Established QMS system which covers DPPM reporting, MRB process, and supplier audit. Build feedback mechanism of unit level datacenter metrics to OSAT. Build Generative AI engine to proactively identify risky material and apply mitigations. Part of a larger team that correlates test solution to lab/OSAT/customer platform to validate silicon design, process, package, and manufacturability to product specifications, Knowledge of platform, package, and silicon power management and thermal is a plus and the ability to connect the dots will help in addressing any product quality issues.

Knowledge of system level tests and failure analysis.     Preferred Qualifications  Strong presentation and communication skills. Knowledgeable in DFT and DFM techniques. Good understanding of bring-up/debug, characterization/manufacturing test (on ATEs). Ability to drive development and bring up test content on mixed signal IP’s is a plus. Strong technical/debug skills with Advantest V93K or any tester platform. Strong probability and statistics background including DOE’s. Experience in  Leading cross functional teams and understanding program/project management. Managing supply chain, vendors / partners, and Integrated Circuit production. Experience in system/customer requirements gathering and interfacing. Device physics background. Experience with failure analysis, qualification, and yield analysis Trusted Computer architecture fundamentals/background Great unit/integration testing skills Solid coding experience using Phyton and/or Java (Smart Test 8) Background in debugging and optimizing software      Adaptability (responds, explores, constructive attitude)   Growth Mindset (It starts with a belief that everyone can grow and develop)         Customer Focus (anticipates needs and proactively meets expectations)     Drive for results (actively pursues outcome, delivers on commitments)       Influence on impact (communicates, networks, persuades, influences)      Judgement (scope problem, builds & applies knowledge)

listings.title: Senior Software Engineer
listings.description: The DPU team brings together state-of-the-art software and hardware expertise to create a highly programmable and high-performance chip with the capability to efficiently handle large data volumes. Thanks to its integrated design, this solution empowers teams to operate with increased agility and deliver significantly superior performance compared to CPU-based alternatives. As a Software Engineer in the DPU core software team, you will develop the runtime software that is responsible for managing and driving the DPU’s custom-built silicon in a variety of new platforms. This opportunity will allow you to develop new systems for the Azure fleet, participate in the design of future cutting-edge DPUs and hone your performance optimization skills. This is a flexible work opportunity that can be fully remote. Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. Responsibilities
listings.responsibilities: Collaborates with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements for a scenario. Drives identification of dependencies and the development of design documents for a product, application, service, or platform. Creates, implements, optimizes, debugs, refactors, and reuses code to establish and improve performance and maintainability, effectiveness, and return on investment (ROI). Leverages subject-matter expertise of product features and partners with appropriate stakeholders (e.g., project managers) to drive a workgroup's project plans, release plans, and work items. Acts as a Designated Responsible Individual (DRI) and guides other engineers by developing and following the playbook, working on call to monitor system/product/service for degradation, downtime, or interruptions, alerting stakeholders about status and initiates actions to restore system/product/service for simple and complex problems when appropriate. Proactively seeks new knowledge and adapts to new trends, technical solutions, and patterns that will improve the availability, reliability, efficiency, observability, and performance of products while also driving consistency in monitoring and operations at scale.

listings.title: Senior Product Manager
listings.description: We are the Windows Servicing and Delivery (WSD) organization with a core mission of accelerating innovation & building trust For the billions of customers we keep protected and productive We deliver seamless and timely update experience for our customers in the existing and future versions of Windows across consumer, enterprise and Microsoft Cloud segments.  Our Currency, Packaging and Commercial (CPC) team is responsible for creating the tools and processes that keep Windows up to date, ensuring that users have the most up-to-date features and security possible. We are looking for highly motivated Senior. Product Manager responsible for designing and building the WSD servicing and delivery pipeline.  As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for building world-class tools and infrastructure to enable updates and feature deliveries to our Windows operating system. You will work closely with cross-functional teams (both here in India and Redmond) to drive successful planning, development, and deployment of the capabilities in your areas.  Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
listings.responsibilities: Develop and execute a comprehensive product strategy and roadmap for your areas, aligned with the overall org vision and goals.  Lead the design, implementation and modernization of the Windows servicing and delivery pipeline system. Investigate and build deep insights on customer scenarios using telemetry/data, customer feedback, anecdotal evidence, and market perceptions. Engage with Leadership, partners and other teams to drive clarity on strategic initiatives. Drive strong delivery strategy, feature specs, and planning rigor while partnering closely with internal stakeholders to crisply define, prioritize end to end scenarios and requirements. Prioritize, manage, and coordinate the work of a team of engineers to deliver features and fixes on regular cadence and track progress against common goals. Work in close co-ordination with Leadership to align on shared goals and define, measure and report on success metrics. Manage schedules, risks, and issues with effective communication to the team, senior management, and partners. Continuously assess user feedback, market trends, and technological advancements to ensure our products and services remain competitive and exceed user expectations.  Provide subject matter expertise with exceptional depth of knowledge for the areas of ownership and integrated partner services.

Strong collaboration, execution, and judgement skills to prioritize and drive work across multiple teams and in multiple development cycles. Great design and problem-solving skills, with a strong bias for simplification and automation. Technical acumen and ability to dive deep to understand technical capabilities, assess dependencies, as part of architecting a solution. Experience in using data, experimentation, KPIs, and Key Results, to measure results and make informed business and product decisions. Passion for customers and partner experience, with ability to balance their needs with business priorities. Proven ability to derive clarity from ambiguity, and direct teams to deliver effective solutions. Effective leadership and high integrity in applying a growth mindset to learn from experience, and build trust within your team and with external partners. Great communications skills, both verbal and written.  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelor's Degree AND 7+ years of experience in product/service/project/program management OR software development OR equivalent experience Strategic thinking to break down a vision to concrete deliverables and milestones. Familiarity with project management strategies & tools Experience in dealing with cross geographical teams and stakeholders. Exceptional interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation and negotiation. Knowledge in Agile engineering practices. Demonstrated experience in cross-team collaboration.

listings.title: Partner Development Manager - GSI
listings.description: The Global Partner Solutions (GPS) team is a sales organization accountable for the commercial partner business at Microsoft, and the mission is to build and sell Microsoft Cloud applications, services and devices with partners, empowering people, and organizations to achieve more. As a Partner Development Manager, we are looking for you to bring your tenacious work ethic, your enthusiasm, optimism, and your unbridled passion for the customer to foster profound growth and change within our partner ecosystem. You will leverage your challenger mindset, sales management skills, deep technology industry knowledge, and best in class interpersonal abilities to empower our partners to bring market-defining solutions to our customers. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth as you work deeply with highly complex partner organizations, building strong relationships in the C-Suite and collaborating across multiple internal stakeholders to accelerate performance and resolve complex issues.  Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond. Partner development and growth You will develop and execute a strategic and tactical partner business plan directly aligned with Microsoft goals and objectives for all managed partners that grow partner business. You will promote cloud consumption and digital transformation; plans will fully consider short- and long-term goals and performance expectations that are aligned with partner’s needs and capabilities. Partner Sales and Acceleration You will develop a go to market plan and co-sell execution tactics, lead partner pipeline reviews and coach and challenge partners to transform their plans and strategies around sales and consumption. You will facilitate collaboration between the partners sales team, Microsoft sales teams, and other relevant teams to overcome obstacles, compete, and create deal proposals to meet consumption and key revenue targets. You will work with your partner on their top opportunities, following Microsoft sales methodology, and prioritize transactions thru marketplace where possible. Partner performance and Impact You will be responsible for your partners’ overall performance with Microsoft and accountable for keeping a regular rhythm of connection at executive, and sales and delivery team levels, to identify and resolve blockers in execution, as well as accelerate performance. You will drive adoption, usage and performance of key programs and investments applicable to your partner, that contribute to sales and consumption with end-customers. You will be responsible for creating correction of error plans when execution is below expectations. Executive Relationship Building You will Build and maintain a trusted-advisor relationship with C-suite leaders of complex partners and will align partners’ priorities, strategies, and goals with Microsoft’s to build mutually beneficial account plans to achieve strategic alignment and drive growth. Partner skills and capacity building You will lead the integration of skills, capability, and capacity plans for your partners utilizing the right mix of sales and tech trainings, and bootcamps to increase the partners' capabilities. You will enable partners to build high-impact Microsoft offerings and practices which grows partner’s business and delivers cloud consumption and digital transformation. Advocate for Partner and Team Mobilizer You will represent the partner internally and lead the orchestration of response to the partner through the resolution of complex and urgent escalations advocating for the partner and guiding other groups in prioritizing partners' solutions and issues. You will orchestrate across various groups in Microsoft and within the partner organization to accelerate partner performance and execution.

listings.title: Azure App Innovation Technology Presales Specialist
listings.description: The Microsoft Azure App Innovation Technology Presales Specialist plays a pivotal role in the ecosystem, focusing on helping customers envision, design, and adopt innovative application solutions on the Azure platform. This role demands a deep understanding of both business and technical aspects to drive digital transformation and deliver impactful technology outcomes. Key Responsibilities:
listings.responsibilities: Customer Engagement: Guide customers in adopting Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), serverless computing, and other Azure-native tools to build new cloud-native applications or modernise existing ones. Leverage Azure's comprehensive suite of services to enhance application performance, scalability, and maintainability. Consultative Selling: Leverage a strong consulting background to bridge the gap between technical potential and business value, demonstrating the transformative power of modern application development. Proof of Concept Development: Develop and deliver proof of concept (PoC) projects that demonstrate the value of Azure solutions, and guide customers through the transition from PoC to full-scale production deployment, ensuring seamless implementation and integration. Technical Leadership: Lead technical discussions, conduct workshops, and develop strategic roadmaps that integrate Azure's advanced technologies into existing frameworks, ensuring seamless adoption and integration. DevOps Integration: Implement Azure DevOps and GitHub Actions to automate and optimise the development lifecycle, ensuring continuous integration and continuous delivery. Knowledge Sharing: Act as a mentor and thought leader, sharing insights and best practices with internal teams and customers to build technical capacity and drive innovation.
